meanings.definition: Make (something) suitable for a new use or purpose.
meanings.sent1: She adapted the recipe by using gluten-free flour.
meanings.sent2: The old house was adapted into a cozy bed and breakfast.
meanings.sent3: He adapted the game rules to include players of all ages.
meanings.sent4: Her teaching style adapted to the needs of each student like a chameleon changing colors.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar adapted to its new environment by spinning a cocoon and transforming into a butterfly.

meanings.sent1: After moving to a new country, she quickly adapted to the different culture.
meanings.sent2: Plants have adapted to survive in various climates over millions of years.
meanings.sent3: The robot adapted to the commands given by its programmer.
meanings.sent4: His mind slowly adapted to the peaceful sounds of nature after living in a noisy city.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut adapted to the weightlessness of space by floating effortlessly in the spacecraft.

meanings.definition: Modify (a text) to make it suitable for filming, broadcasting, or the stage.
meanings.sent1: The book was adapted into a successful movie that captured the essence of the story.
meanings.sent2: The playwright adapted the script to fit the shorter time slot.
meanings.sent3: The editor adapted the article to appeal to a wider audience.
meanings.sent4: The director adapted the play, adding new scenes to enhance the storyline.
meanings.sent5: The screenwriter adapted the novel into a screenplay, staying true to the original plot.
